question: Match the following columns where [x] denotes greatest integer function.
| Column I | Column II |
| (a) <katex>$x|x|$</katex> | (i) continuous in (-1,1) |
| (b) <katex>$\sqrt{|x|}$</katex> | (ii) differentiable in (-1,1) |
| (c) <katex>$x+[x]$</katex> | (iii) strictly increasing in (-1,1) |
| (d) <katex>$|x-1|+|x+1|$</katex> | (iv) not differentiable at least one point in (-1,1) |
explanation: (a) <katex>$x|x|$</katex> is <katex>$x^2$</katex> for <katex>$x>0$</katex>, <katex>$-x^2$</katex> for <katex>$x<0$</katex>. Differentiable everywhere. Matches (ii).
(b) <katex>$\sqrt{|x|}$</katex> has a sharp corner at 0 (vertical tangent). Not differentiable at 0. Matches (iv).
(c) <katex>$x+[x]$</katex> increases as x increases. Strictly increasing. Matches (iii).
(d) <katex>$|x-1|+|x+1|$</katex> is constant 2 in <katex>$[-1,1]$</katex>. Continuous everywhere. Matches (i) (also differentiable in (-1,1)).
The best fit is option (3): a-ii, b-iv, c-iii, d-i.
